biography.bio: Martha Hyer was born on August 10, 1924 in Fort Worth, Texas. Once she finished her formal schooling, Martha played a bit role in 1946's The Locket (1946). Slowly, Martha began picking up roles with more and more substance. The best years for the beautiful actress began in 1954 when she played in films such as Down Three Dark Streets (1954), Showdown at Abilene (1956) and Battle Hymn (1957). Perhaps the best role of her long career was as "Gwen French" in 1958's Some Came Running (1958) in which she starred opposite Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin and Shirley MacLaine. As a result of her stellar role, Martha received an Academy Award nomination as Best Supporting Actress, but she lost out to Wendy Hiller in Separate Tables (1958). Afterwards, Martha's stint on the US silver screen's trailed off some. She did make a handful of foreign films, returning to appear in the US from time to time, but nothing compared to the pace she had in the fifties. Her last film was in 1973 in the film The Day of the Wolves (1971). In 1966, she married producer Hal B. Wallis and remained with him until his death in 1986.
biography.name: Martha Hyer

biography.bio: Argentinian actress. Daughter of a theater writer, and sister of the writer Carlos Gorostiza. At the age of 15 she escapes from a religious school to win a beauty contest in Buenos Aires. She debuted in cinema in 1947 and in theater in 1950. She worked in around 20 films in Argentina and in 1956 she went to Madrid. She was married to the Argentinian actor and director Juan Carlos Thorry and later to the Venezeulan actor Espartaco Santoni.
biography.name: Analía Gadé

biography.bio: John Ronane was born on December 11, 1933. He is an actor, known for Strangers (1978), Most High (2012) and King Rat (1965).
biography.name: John Ronane

biography.bio: Ángel del Pozo was born on July 14, 1934 in Spain as Ángel del Pozo Merino. He is an actor and director, known for The Passenger (1975), Horror Express (1972) and The Four Musketeers: Milady's Revenge (1974).
biography.name: Ángel del Pozo

biography.bio: Elisa Ramírez was born on December 2, 1943 in Alzira, Valencia, Comunidad Valenciana, Spain as Elisa Ramírez Sanz. She is an actress, known for The Wanton of Spain (1969), La marquesa Rosalinda (1981) and Memorias del general Escobar (1984).
biography.name: Elisa Ramírez

biography.bio: He began the studies of law. But after his participation in the universitary theater he left the university and entered the school of dramatic arts in Madrid. In 1945 he debuted in the proffesional theater, and in the cinema in 1947.
biography.name: Manuel Alexandre

biography.bio: María Francés was born on February 2, 1887 in Tudela, Navarra, Spain as María Francés García. She was an actress, known for Placido (1961), Déracinés (1951) and Madrugada (1957). She died on December 9, 1987 in Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain.
biography.name: María Francés

biography.bio: Pastora Peña was born on July 24, 1920 in Madrid, Spain as Pastora Peña y Illescas. She was an actress, known for Porque te vi llorar (1941), Una noche en blanco (1949) and Le muchacho (1956). She was married to José "Pepe" Bienvenida y .. She died on October 10, 2003 in Madrid.
biography.name: Pastora Peña

biography.bio: Erasmo Pascual was born on May 6, 1903 in Ribadavia, Ourense, Galicia, Spain as Erasmo Pascual Colmenero. He was an actor, known for Le bourreau (1963), Furtivos (1975) and Bell from Hell (1973). He was married to Rafaela Aparicio. He died on June 7, 1975 in Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Erasmo Pascual

biography.bio: Rafaela Aparicio was born in 1906, the daughter of a merchant ship pilot. She began her career on stage in 1931 at age 23 in the play "El conflicto de Mercedes" after having worked for a few years as a teacher. She is a symbol for the Andalusian woman, smart and happy. With The Sea and the Weather (1989) she won the Goya award as Best Actress. In total she has made more than 100 movies.
biography.name: Rafaela Aparicio

biography.bio: Rafael Hernández was a police bike-driver when he began his career in cinema, in Manolo guardia urbano (1956); since then (without leaving the police department), with his peculiar voice, his man-of-the-street appearance and his perennial moustache, he intervened in almost 200 films, playing bit-parts and supporting characters, mostly in Spanish movies but also in some english language ones, like Lawrence of Arabia (1962)
biography.name: Rafael Hernández

biography.bio: Ángel de Andrés was born on May 25, 1918 in Madrid, Spain as Angel de Andrés Miquel. He was an actor and writer, known for Esquilache (1989), Historias de la radio (1955) and El hincha (1958). He was married to Conchita Juárez. He died on August 5, 2006 in Madrid, Comunidad de Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Ángel de Andrés

biography.bio: Ana María Noé was born in 1914 in Palma de Mallorca, Spain. She was an actress, known for Vida de familia (1963), Los cuervos (1961) and The Hiding Places (1969). She died on July 9, 1970 in Madrid, Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Ana María Noé

biography.bio: Alberto Dalbés was born on April 3, 1922 in Rosario, Argentina as Francisco Eduardo Eyres Martínez. He was an actor, known for Night of the Assassins (1974), The Erotic Rites of Frankenstein (1973) and Cut-Throats Nine (1972). He died on September 14, 1983 in Madrid, Spain.
biography.name: Alberto Dalbés

biography.bio: Fosco Giachetti was born on March 28, 1900 in Sesto Fiorentino, Tuscany, Italy. He was an actor, known for The Conformist (1970), Bengasi (1942) and The Siege of the Alcazar (1940). He died on December 22, 1974 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Fosco Giachetti

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Won Prize of the National Syndicate of Spectacle
